careers.title: Architectural Project Manager
careers.content:
ABOUT FITCH

Designing the future. FITCH transforms consumer experience and accelerates business success. We deliver seamless solutions by combining the physical, human and digital elements of a brand to create unique experience signatures.

FITCH is a leading global retail and brand consultancy with an integrated offer of strategy, design and implementation, which enables us to deliver across all touchpoints. We do this for clients that include adidas, B&Q, Brown-Forman, Dell, H&M, Philips, and Sberbank. FITCH is a WPP company (NYSE). www.fitch.com

Job Purpose:

Responsible for management and coordination of client programs in conjunction with the Studio Director and Program Manager, acting as a liaison between client and FITCH to successfully orchestrate architectural projects with internal teams, consultants, vendors, and clients to ensure successful, coordinated results

Key Responsibilities:

  • Responsible for the oversight and completion of all assigned architectural projects within approved contract budget and timing
  • Consistently providing accurate and timely communication to client and internal teams, inclusive of status reports
  • Demonstrable ability to develop and execute a variety of project work plans
  • Clear ability to work with a high volume of clients and projects within the studio in conjunction with successfully managing project teams
  • Providing detailed project management administration on specific projects and responsible for managing client expectations in accordance with contract deliverables
  • Preparing, communicating, and monitoring project work plans, budgets, and deliverables for client and internal teams
  • Ensuring that resources are secured to effectively facilitate timelines and deliverables
  • Assisting in client presentations and proposal development where required
  • Confident in presenting FITCH’s offering in a knowledgeable and compelling manner
  • Actively participates in strategic planning initiatives and initiates excellent solutions and encourages pro-active behavior in the studio

Professional and Technical Experience:

  • Degree in architecture or related discipline including industrial or interior design services experience preferred
  • Minimum of 10 years’ experience in an architectural organization as a Job Captain and/or Project Manager with demonstrable ability to understand project functions, requirements and work flow
  • Preferred experience working in the retail, hospitality, and grocery industry
  • Knowledge of MEP systems and ability to communicate with Clients and Engineers as required
  • Thorough knowledge of national building codes
  • Solid knowledge of construction materials and methods, and initiative to research as required
  • Knowledge of AutoCAD/Revit
  • Ability to review and redline plans
  • Strong verbal and written communication and presentation skills
  • Detail-oriented with exceptional organizational skills; must be able to multi-task and prioritize
  • Ability to coordinate, motivate, and supervise project staff, whilst working closely with other executives

Key Success Factors:

  • Ability to analyze both success and failures for opportunities of improvement in the project management process
  • Accuracy of scoping length and difficulty of tasks and projects, developing schedules and task/people assignments and contingency planning
  • Ability to perform well in a team environment to produce outstanding quality work
  • Confidence in priority setting with the ability to quickly assess and time plans around key goals
  • Orchestrating multiple activities to accomplish client goals, using resources effectively and efficiently and ensuring client expectations are met on time and within budget

careers.title: Architectural Job Captain
careers.content:
ABOUT FITCH

Designing the future. FITCH transforms consumer experience and accelerates business success. We deliver seamless solutions by combining the physical, human and digital elements of a brand to create unique experience signatures.

FITCH is a leading global retail and brand consultancy with an integrated offer of strategy, design and implementation, which enables us to deliver across all touchpoints. We do this for clients that include adidas, B&Q, Brown-Forman, Dell, H&M, Philips, and Sberbank. FITCH is a WPP company (NYSE). www.fitch.com

Job Purpose:

  • Producing and coordinating the completion of all construction documents and building submittals for commercial client base
  • Creates functional architectural documents using familiarity with construction practices and procedures.
  • Managing and mentoring CAD technicians in the studio

Key Responsibilities:

  • Consistently delivers high quality work to the team as measured by AOR & Project Manager feedback.
  • Responsible for producing a complete set of construction documents across a variety of commercial projects in the studio at a high level
  • Consistently delivers and make project deadlines on, or ahead of the scheduled delivery date and within budget
  • Directs CAD technicians in the completion of construction documents to ensure deadlines are met on time and within budget while coordinating project knowledge to ensure client goals are met.
  • Acts as first point of contact for building departments and landlords to ensure successful coordination of projects and any required corrections
  • Contributes to the RFP process, and notifies PM of observed market trends and opportunities for the client
  • Acts as a mentor and trainer to the studio’s CAD Technicians in AutoCAD, construction techniques, and cost/time management
  • Communicates with the Project Manager and Studio Director to understand financial impacts to the project

Professional and Technical Experience:

  • Minimum 5 years’ experience within an architectural environment
  • Technical degree (2 years) in Architectural Drafting or 4 year degree in Architecture or related discipline
  • Ability to create and manage schedules and deadlines in Excel, MS Project, or similar
  • Expert knowledge of AutoCAD software programs and experience setting up and working in managed office CAD standards
  • Strong knowledge of IBC, national, and regional building codes, ADA requirements, and energy codes
  • Knowledge of MEP systems and ability to communicate with Clients and Engineers as required
  • Demonstrable experience producing complete commercial construction documents for JHA submittal and managing the permitting process.
  • Knowledge of coordinating consultants, answering RFIs, and adhering to standard AIA construction documentation practices.
  • Experience managing and adjusting schedules, overseeing drafters, and redlining and reviewing plan sets.
  • Strong verbal and written communication and presentation skills

Key Success Factors:

  • Ability and judgement to create project schedules against a budget and meet deadlines
  • Ability to perform consistently and reliably with a willingness to increase professional responsibilities and skills
  • Strong leadership and effectively mentoring and training new talent

careers.title: Associate Design Director (Branded Environments)
careers.content:
Associate Design Director / Branded Environments

Summary

We're looking for conceptual designers with very strong (7 years plus) retail/branded environments experience to join our fast growing Indian studios.

You will work on a wide variety of environment design projects from malls to supermarkets and brand experience centres to exhibition stands, throughout India and South Asia for a mixture of international and local brands.

 

Main Duties

  • Be a key part of the retail/branded environments design team, working on and leading large scale projects
  • Work closely with the insights and strategy team to develop breakthrough, creative ideas and articulate the ideas in the creative brief
  • Be proactively involved in the entire lifecycle of a project including initial briefings, day-to-day direction, storyboarding and creative review meetings
  • Lead creative presentations and orchestrate other team members to present the work

careers.title: Creative Director - Environments
careers.content:
Reporting to: Executive Creative Director or Managing Director

Job Purpose:

  • Lead and be responsible for the development and performance of the creative studio
  • Accountable for the creative reputation and output of the studio
  • Play a leadership role in the general management and future direction of the the studio

Background

Reporting to the ECD or MD, the role leads the creative studio culturally and is responsible for the quality of the creative product and output.

In addition, the role operates as a senior member of the management team working with other department heads in guiding and shaping the future direction and growth of the studio.

The role works alongside the Studio Director to ensure the smooth operation of the creative studio within the broader context of management of the studio overall.

Key Responsibilities

The majority of time within the role is dedicated to:

  • playing a senior consultative creative role for projects within the studio providing both an holistic overview as well as a detailed understanding where relevant
  • ensuring and inspiring the development of best practice skills in the creation and delivery of work
  • fostering strong collaborative teams across skillsets
  • championship of FITCH manifesto and process with other key stakeholders
  • working as part of a team to foster long term client relationships
  • play an active role in business development activities and studio growth initiatives
  • actively participating and positively impacting the general management of the studio and its activities
  • providing support, as required, to studio and creative development plans in the region, focussing on delivering strategic objectives and ensuring consistent delivery of the creative product

Primary Activities

On a day to day basis:

  • establishment of a clear structure for the day to day management of the studio
  • management with Studio Director of the operational running of the studio utilising all available resources
  • mentoring of creative teams - leading role for key projects; support role in smaller projects working via DDs and ADDs
  • creative benchmarking internally and externally via an understanding of the dynamics within the industry as a whole
  • establishment and facilitation of a relevant, value add “catalyst” programme for the studio
  • overseeing all creative recruitment
  • key role in business development and creatively leading pitch teams
  • working with the Business Development function, profile building for individuals and studio via PR and awards programmes
  • active participation in the required activities of the management team – regular meetings and follow-up actions

Key Relationships

Within the studio key relationships will be with:

  • Managing Director
  • Finance Director
  • Studio Director
  • Client Services Director
  • Strategic Planning Director
  • Business Development Director
  • Design Directors

In addition, important relationships external to the London studio will be

  • CCO
  • Senior regional management

Key Success Factors

  • Strength and stability of the London creative studio
  • Cohesiveness between disciplines
  • Assessment of creative output
  • Number and quality of awards
  • Industry profile
  • Credibility across the business
  • Working relationships
  • Impact on general management and overall growth of the studio

  • Promoting and developing creative thinking
  • Providing overall large project creative direction
  • Mentoring and nurturing creatives
  • Regularly reviewing creative work
  • Creative lead on all pitch development
  • Key client contact for all creative issues
  • Fostering team approach to working with other skillsets – planning, insights and client services
  • Working with creative directors in establishing future creative vision
  • Pro-actively developing initiatives for the creative studio
  • Liaising with studio director on resource/project issues

Key Responsibilities:

  • Leadership - creatively leading the studio alongside the other Design Directors, both formally and informally; representing the company as a positive ambassador at all times both within the studio and all external audiences
  • Mentoring – to motivate, inspire and nurture ADDs and designers, both personally and professionally; reviewing and performing appraisals of team members; highlight training issues and requirements for individual designers
  • Best Practice – ensuring that ADD and designers are integrated and focused within the company; working in conjunction with the Studio Manager and Designer Directors to ensure the correct mix of skills and levels of experience for various projects
  • Communication – keeping the Creative Director and administrative staff informed of design related issues

External – Project Leader

Main Duties

  • Creative direction
  • Efficient and cost effective project direction
  • Creative issues for the team
  • Active involvement of generation of new business

Key Responsibilities

  • Leadership – undertaking all aspects of creative project leadership, i.e. setting up projects, identifying key project members and their roles, adhering to timescales, budgets and productivity
  • Creativity – ensuring creative direction and highest creative standards in accordance with the design brief
  • Client Management – assisting Client Managers and Directors with direct client liaison, when required
  • Business Development – helping consultants develop new and existing business opportunities
  • Delivery – liaising with nominated Client Managers and Creative to ensure proper work flow and timely execution of projects
  • Planning – working alongside the strategic planning team in the development of design briefs and their proper articulation to design teams
  • Communication – assisting in the presentation of completed design work to end client, where required
  • Commercial – managing financial resources with the proper approvals of senior management and the financial team

Professional and Technical Experience:

  • Professional qualification(s) of a high standard
  • Solid design experience in a similar creative environment
  • Strong consumer brand experience
  • Ability to communicate ideas, i.e. sketches, written, verbal
  • Demonstrable experience of liaising and developing client relationships
  • Proactive approach to technology, software and industry innovations
  • Proven ability in offering a multi-skilled and challenging outlook to creative briefs
  • Ability to perform consistently and reliably with a willingness to increase professional responsibilities, skills and understanding of broader market issues
  • Comprehensive experience in creative software relative to design software

Key Success Factors:

  • Strength of strategic and creative outlook
  • Demonstrable success in leading, motivating and communicating
  • Creative impact and ability to manage the complete delivery of projects
  • Mentoring and development of new talent
  • Understanding Bold Thinking and how it translates into design

careers.title: Design Director (Retail Environments), Shanghai
careers.content:
Design Director (Retail Environments), Shanghai

Reports to: Executive Creative Director, APAC

Based: Shanghai

FITCH is designing the future of retail – seamless consumer experiences for an increasingly ‘omnichannel / O2O’ world. Established in 1972 with 14 studios in 9 countries, FITCH is part of WPP, the world’s leading marketing services group.

Job Purpose

Represent FITCH’s infatuation with the future of retail and seamless consumer experiences – must be curious and passionate about the impact of design in shaping the future.

Take overall responsibility for creative work across omnichannel for the Shanghai studio and all China projects.

To develop highly innovative and creative solutions to strategically driven projects across omnichannel, providing design leadership and inspiration through individual talent and work ethics.

 

Job Responsibilities

• Champion the retail environments skill area and provide overall creative leadership for environments-related project work.

• Work closely with the insights and strategy team to develop breakthrough, creative ideas and articulate the ideas in the creative brief.

• Lead and develop multi-skilled teams of designers, strategists, researchers, production specialists including initial briefings, day-to-day direction, storyboarding, creative review meetings.

• Lead creative presentations and orchestrate other team members to present the work.

• Monitor and circulate latest environments design-related trends information.

• Capture and document project case studies.

• Develop links with counter-part Directors in other FITCH studios around the world.

• Contribute to annual strategy and budget planning plus quarterly reporting updates.

• Contribute proactively to business development efforts, pitches, existing client opportunities, proposal writing and pitch presentations.

 

Skills 

• Qualification: Degree in interior design, or related field.

• Minimum 10 years of retail design / omnichannel experience in the Asia region.

• Curious and passionate about the impact of design in shaping the future

• Proven track record in creative idea generation and development.

• Ability to think strategically with knowledge of marketing principles.

• Exceptional presentation, organizational and time management skills.

• Excellent verbal and written communication, selling, negotiation and interpersonal skills.

• Leadership and management skills with ability to work with and motivate others in team.

• Fluency in English & Mandarin.

• Must be prepared to travel when required.

• Works well across different cultures.

• Results-oriented, hands-on and self motivated.

• Proficient in design software ideally Vectorworks / AutoCad and 3DMax / Cinema 4D.  Well skilled in all Microsoft Office programs (PowerPoint, Excel, Word), Adobe Acrobat and an understanding of the capabilities of the Adobe Creative Suite (Photoshop, Illustrator, In-Design).

careers.title: Finance Assistant
careers.content:
Reporting to: Financial Controller

  • Submit requests to create new suppliers when required and ensure supporting paperwork is received.
  • Receive and verify supplier invoices.
  • Raise PO’s for 3rd party vendors and intercompany
  • Monitor and reconcile freelancer tracker to PO’s and invoices.
  • Check and post employee expenses claims.
  • Verify that transactions comply with financial policies and SOX procedures.
  • Prepare invoice batches for data entry and payment via our process center.
  • Prepare month end schedules and assist in closing of accounts.
  • Preparation of journals for general ledger postings.
  • Take responsibility for ensuring timesheets are entered by studio team in a timely manner and against the correct project jobs.
  • Maintain an accurate and up to date filing system for financial documents.
  • Assist in Finance ad-hoc projects as required.

 

Professional and Technical Experience:

  • Minimum 2 years accounting experience
  • Must possess at least CAT / LCCI / Diploma in Accountancy
  • Highly proficient in Microsoft Office Suite with particular flair in Excel spreadsheets
  • Finance system experience, preferably Maconomy
  • Excellent numeracy

  • Willingness to undertake any other duties as may be required from time to time
  • Ability to work to tight deadlines with some flexibility around working hours in these periods
  • Positive approach to working with all members of the studio team and external contacts

careers.content:
Designing the future. FITCH transforms consumer experience and accelerates business success. We deliver seamless solutions by combining the physical, human and digital elements of a brand to create unique experience signatures.

FITCH is a leading global retail and brand consultancy with an integrated offer of strategy, design and implementation, which enables us to deliver across all touchpoints. We do this for clients that include adidas, B&Q, Brown-Forman, Dell, H&M, Philips, and Sberbank. FITCH is a WPP company (NYSE). www.fitch.com

Job Purpose:
To ensure time and expenses are recorded against the correct project jobs. To ensure client invoices are raised  accurately and on a timely basis. To ensure client payments are received on time and allocated to the system.

Key Responsibilities:
• Raising invoices and credits in a timely manner ensuring all supporting paperwork is received and checked in line with SOX and other internal control processes
• Creating and maintaining job/project files with all relevant client sign off and purchase orders, as well as all other necessary job related correspondence
• Leading monthly client finance meetings with Client Services teams to monitor WIP reports and billing schedules to ensure that all costs and fees are billed on time
• Posting the reallocation of expenses/time between jobs where required
• Liaising with the client finance contacts to ensure that billing plans/processes are adhered to
• Take responsibility for credit control, liaising with client finance contacts to ensure issues are resolved and invoices paid on time
• Ability to work closely with the Financial Controller and other team members to support month end accounting, forecasting and adhoc analysis

Professional and Technical Experience:
• Finance system experience, preferably Maconomy
• Proficient in Microsoft Office packages, especially Excel
• Excellent numeracy
• Architecture/Construction billing experience
• Client/customer service experience

Key Success Factors:
• Willingness to undertake any other duties as may be required from time to time
• Ability to work to tight deadlines with some flexibility around working hours in these periods
• Proactive, positive approach to working with all members of the studio team and external contacts

careers.title: Strategy Director
careers.content:
Reporting to: General Manager, Singapore & CEO, Asia Pacific

Job Purpose:

  • Driving the strategy across all client relationships/projects and business development initiatives
  • Ensuring strategy is represented in the creative and client relationship model.
  • Originate new ideas and thinking that are used as the platform to deliver innovative and transformational design.
  • Acting as a strategic partner to client services, creative and business development teams

 

Key Responsibilities:

  • Collaboration

Leading FITCH Singapore’s Planning and Insights total offer alongside the CEO, Executive Creative Director and General Manager

Keeping designers regularly updated with the strategic direction of a project.

Key participation in mentoring and development for new business

  • Client

Acting as a senior consultative member of the Singapore team, responsible for managing internal delivery against project deadlines and revenue with Client Service Leads.

  • Business Development

Play an active role in business development for new business and farming initiatives on clients & opportunities.

  • Cutting edge

Developing/collaborating and evangelising the latest in-house thinking and tools on brand and experience, as it pertains to the FITCH offer.

­Be a leader in championing omnichannel in retail.

Assist in the development of new planning tools and processes.

  • Global planning community

Contribute to the collective knowledge of the planning & insights teams globally.

  • Leadership

With the CEO and General Manager, leading & developing the Singapore studio strategic planning team.

Fostering process, methodology and simulation of trend work and strategic thinking within the studio.

  • Deep knowledge and expertise ­

Create a bank of knowledge across specific sectors, consumers, brand, etc.

Designing primary consumer research studies, participating in fielding research (as necessary), analysing and reporting results.

  • FITCH initiatives

From retail safaris to FITCH 515, to drive knowledge sharing and ‘Must Sees’ in the world of retail.

Creation and publication of a minimum of one thought piece per year

As an active member, evangelise and evolve the FITCH strategic planning community

 

Example Deliverables:

  • Brand strategy & idea creation
  • Brand translation into communication/experience
  • Creative digital strategy
  • Workshop and work session
  • Design research program
  • Communication ideas & frameworks
  • Brand Models – including idea, master vision, architecture & authorship
  • Strategic Retail Framework – including omnichannel experience principles & creative ideas
  • Format strategy & principles
  • Channel & Messaging framework & mapping
  • Consumer insight, decision making process
  • Brand engagement, internal and external
  • Service action and design

Key Success Factors:

 Make strategy and planning a  distinguished offer for FITCH

  • Build profile for strategy within FITCH and externally in the branding and design industry
  • Realisation of strategic planning as a standard of excellence
  • Creation of project opportunities via strategic offering
    • Impact business performance
    • Develop and mentor strategy and insights team
    • Strength of working relationships – internal and external
    • Active participant with Senior Management to evolve and inspire the studio on strategy, idea generation and omnichannel knowledge and hence its performance

 

Professional Qualifications

  • MBA/Bachelor Degree in Business, Marketing or Social Sciences preferred
  • Minimum 12 years multi-disciplinary strategy and planning experience Asia market experience required
  • Strong knowledge of all aspects of retail & digital design strategy, insight methods, brand strategy and positioning in consumer market
  • Strategy writing including retail and brand strategy proposals, brand: naming, architecture and engagement along with creative briefings
  • Experience in retail positioning, design strategy, and understanding consumer/shopper behaviour
  • Experience applying branding frameworks to define and communicate strategic intent to clients
  • Proven ability in leading projects and solving insights
  • Excellent interpersonal and communication (presentation – both spoken and written) skills, honed within the design industry
  • Fluency in English essential, Mandarin strongly preferred
  • Ability to think laterally with great attention to detail
  • Excellent listening skills and ability to respond to briefs accurately
  • Balanced analytical and creative mindset, ability to swiftly prioritize competing priorities, and knowledge of retail and branding best practices
